intro: Hedlundia pulchra, commonly known as the beautiful hedlund, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Hedlundia pulchra is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking blooms and compact growth habit.
